header.title: ssh_client_key_api

description.p: Behavior describing the API for public key handling of an SSH client. By implementing the callbacks defined in this behavior, the public key handling of an SSH client can be customized. By default the ssh application implements this behavior with help of the standard OpenSSH files, see the ssh(6) application manual.

section.title: DATA TYPES
section.p: Type definitions that are used more than once in this module, or abstractions to indicate the intended use of the data type, or both. For more details on public key data types, refer to Section 2 Public Key Records in the public_key user's guide:

func.name: Module:add_host_key(HostNames, Key, ConnectOptions) -> ok | {error, Reason}
func.fsummary: Adds a host key to the set of trusted host keys.

type.d: Description of the host that owns the PublicKey.
Normally an RSA or DSA public key, but handling of other public keys can be added.

desc.p: Adds a host key to the set of trusted host keys.

func.name: Module:is_host_key(Key, Host, Algorithm, ConnectOptions) -> Result
func.fsummary: Checks if a host key is trusted.

type.d: Normally an RSA or DSA public key, but handling of other public keys can be added.
Host key algorithm. Is to support 'ssh-rsa'| 'ssh-dss', but more algorithms can be handled.

desc.p: Checks if a host key is trusted.

func.name: Module:user_key(Algorithm, ConnectOptions) -> {ok, PrivateKey} | {error, Reason}
func.fsummary: Fetches the users public key matching the Algorithm.

type.d: Host key algorithm. Is to support 'ssh-rsa'| 'ssh-dss' but more algorithms can be handled.
Private key of the user matching the Algorithm.

desc.p: Fetches the users public key matching the Algorithm.

note.p: The private key contains the public key.
